name: Mercury
surfaceDescription: Mercury is the smallest planet in our solar system and closest to the Sun.
formationInfo: Mercury formed about 4.5 billion years ago, similar to other planets in our solar system.

name: Venus
surfaceDescription: Venus is the second planet from the Sun and has a thick, toxic atmosphere.
formationInfo: Venus likely formed from the solar nebula around the same time as Earth.

name: Earth
surfaceDescription: Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only planet known to support life.
formationInfo: Earth formed about 4.5 billion years ago from the accretion of the solar nebula.

name: Mars
surfaceDescription: Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun and is known as the Red Planet.
formationInfo: Mars formed from the solar nebula around 4.5 billion years ago.

name: Jupiter
surfaceDescription: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system and has a Great Red Spot.
formationInfo: Jupiter likely formed by the rapid accretion of gas around a solid core.

name: Saturn
surfaceDescription: Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun, famous for its prominent ring system.
formationInfo: Saturn formed about 4.5 billion years ago, possibly from the same materials as Jupiter.

name: Uranus
surfaceDescription: Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun and has a unique sideways rotation.
formationInfo: Uranus likely formed from the solar nebula, similar to the other gas giants.

name: Neptune
surfaceDescription: Neptune is the eighth planet from the Sun and is known for its strong winds.
formationInfo: Neptune likely formed in a similar way to Uranus, from the solar nebula.
